thread.title: Ducks stay off road, will not return to Aurora Bridge
thread.title_full: Ducks stay off road, will not return to Aurora Bridge | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Ducks stay off road, will not return to Aurora Bridge
text:
Ride the Ducks of Seattle said Thursday its tour boats will no longer use the Aurora Bridge if they are able to return to the road.
It was a week ago Thursday that five international college students were killed when the Ride the Ducks of Seattle vehicle they were in rammed into a tour bus on the Aurora Bridge.
At his previously scheduled news conference, Gov. Jay Inslee remembered the victims.
“We have all been touched by the tragedy. These children are ours no matter what country they are from,” he said.
The company voluntarily suspended tours and Thursday agreed with the state Utilities and Transportation Commission to stay off the road while the UTC investigates safety companywide.
That means not just inspecting the vehicles but also looking into the way they are operated by just one driver playing a dual role.
“The drivers of your vehicles not only have to drive the vehicles but they have to entertain the passengers. And is that too much to ask given the complexity of the vehicles?” asked commission chair David Danner.
If the commission says the tours can resume safely, the owner says Ducks will no longer use the narrow lanes on the Aurora Bridge.
“His trucks will not be using the Aurora Bridge. They will be using a different route,” said Pat Buchannan, a lawyer representing Ride the Ducks Seattle.
While the commission has said it may be able to complete the safety investigation in 30 days, both sides agreed that there is no time limit.
